item.title: India Rupee, Bonds Rise as Trading Resumes After Pakistan Truce
item.description: India’s rupee rallied the most in nearly two weeks and bonds rose as trading resumed after a long weekend, supported by a ceasefire with Pakistan that fueled a surge in local stocks.
item.dc:creator: Subhadip Sircar

item.title: Traders Slash RBA Easing Bets as US-China De-Escalate on Tariffs
item.description: Traders are winding back bets on aggressive monetary easing by Australia in a cascading effect from the US and China agreeing to temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Burgess, Swati Pandey

item.title: What the US-China Trade Truce Means for Australia
item.description: Tensions between the Washington and Beijing have seen a dramatic de-escalation, with China committing to suspend its non-tariff barriers on American imports. USSC Economic Security Program Director Hayley Channer discusses about what this means for Australia, as the Albanese government tries to strike a balance between ties with both superpowers. She speaks on 'Bloomberg: The Asia Trade.' (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Chinese Stocks Slide as Trade Truce Seen Dashing Stimulus Hopes
item.description: Chinese stocks fell in Hong Kong on Tuesday, as initial optimism from the tariff truce with the US gave way to concerns that Beijing won’t feel the need to urgently ramp up growth stimulus.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Lin Zhu

item.title: US Oil Output Has Peaked. But Don’t Expect a Rapid Decline.
item.description: Nothing suggests that a repetition of 2020’s plunge is imminent.
item.dc:creator: Javier Blas

media:content.media:description: A vertical oil drilling rig in Midland, Texas, U.S. on Monday, April 4, 2022. West Texas, the proud oil-drilling capital of America, is now also on the cusp of becoming the earthquake capital of America.

item.title: Most Asian Stocks Gain After US-China Trade Truce: Markets Wrap
item.description: Most Asian stocks rose, following a rally in US equities, on optimism the US-China trade truce marks the end to an all-out tariff war.
item.dc:creator: Winnie Hsu

item.title: Astellas CEO on Outlook Ahead of Trump's Pharma Tariffs
item.description: The global pharmaceutical industry is grappling with an uncertain outlook, amid President Donald Trump's plans to cut US prescription drug prices and impose tariffs on pharma imports. Astellas Pharma is among the Japanese drug makers that depends on the US for a large chunk of sales. CEO Naoki Okamura spoke to Bloomberg TV in Tokyo on May 7th about the impact of Trump's tariffs, and the firm's engagement with activist investor Farallon Capital Management. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Nomura Turns Bullish on China’s Stocks After Trade Truce With US
item.description: Nomura Holdings Inc. strategists upgraded Chinese stocks to a ‘tactical overweight,’ saying the trade truce between the US and China is a significant positive for the Asian nation’s equities.
item.dc:creator: Abhishek Vishnoi

media:content.media:description: Signage outside a branch of Nomura Securities Co. Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg

item.title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 5/13/25
item.description: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Taiwan Insurers Hit by Losses in April on US Dollar Slump
item.description: Taiwan’s biggest insurers posted a total loss of almost NT$19 billion ($620 million) in April due to currency volatility after US President Donald Trump warned of a wave of global trade tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Miaojung Lin

item.title: Goldman Raises S&P 500 Targets on Lower Tariff, Recession Risks
item.description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. lifted its US stock targets, as the easing of trade tensions between the US and China fuels a comeback of the “Buy America” trade.
item.dc:creator: John Cheng

item.title: Xi Courts Latin America as Trump’s Tariffs Pressure Region
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping vowed to deepen economic cooperation with Latin American and Caribbean nations and offered visa-free entry to some countries, as he seeks to position China as a better partner than the US.
item.dc:creator: Colum Murphy, Jing Li

media:content.media:description: China's President Xi Jinping speaks during the opening ceremony of the Fourth Ministerial Meeting of the Forum of China and Community of Latin American and Caribbean States (CELAC), in Beijing on May 13, 2025. (Photo by Pedro Pardo / AFP) (Photo by PEDRO PARDO/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Hong Kong Dollar Slide Aided by Record Low Cost for Short Bets
item.description: The cost of shorting the Hong Kong dollar has slumped to an all-time low, as the currency weakens to the middle of its fixed trading band.
item.dc:creator: Iris Ouyang

item.title: Iron Ore Resumes Drop on Challenging Outlook After Trade Boost
item.description: Iron ore fell as a broad, risk-on lift that followed the US-China trade truce faded, with traders turning their attention back to a challenging industry backdrop.
item.dc:creator: Katharine Gemmell

item.title: Vinpearl Shares Surge by Limit in Vietnamese Trading Debut
item.description: Shares of Vinpearl JSC jumped by the limit in their trading debut as the hospitality unit of Vietnam’s largest business empire became one of the country’s biggest listed companies.
item.dc:creator: Giang Nguyen

media:content.media:description: The logo for the Ho Chi Minh Stock Exchange (HOSE) Photographer: Brent Lewin/

item.title: 'Clarity Factor' Underpins Market Rally: StanChart
item.description: Some uncertainties that investors were concerned about have been addressed by the recent US-China trade truce, causing markets to rally. That's according to Standard Chartered's Daniel Lam. Nevertheless, the continued fear of inflation remains an "elephant in the room," Lam adds. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: There Are Opportunities in HK, Japan Equities, JPMorgan Says
item.description: JPMorgan Asset Management's Jin Yuejue says investors are "embracing the good news" coming from US-China trade talks, but adds that the time frame is "probably not sufficient to get down to a detailed agreement." She also tells Bloomberg Television that the firm sees some opportunities in Hong Kong and Japan equities. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Rising Yields Fray Nerves Going Into Japan’s 30-Year Bond Sale
item.description: Traders are jittery going into Japan’s auction of 30-year government bonds Tuesday for any signs of a deepening selloff in the securities.
item.dc:creator: Ayai Tomisawa, Mia Glass

item.title: Marubeni CEO on Tariffs Impact, Business Strategy
item.description: Masayuki Omoto, President and CEO at Marubeni, discusses the trading house's business strategy and the impact from the US trade tariffs. He speaks with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Tariffs Create World Challenges, Opportunities, WTO Head Says
item.description: The global trade war with its persistent barrage of tariff developments provides both challenges and opportunities, according to Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, the Director General of the World Trade Organisation.
item.dc:creator: Yoshiaki Nohara

item.title: Japan Stocks Head for Longest Rally Since 2009 on US-China Deal
item.description: Japanese stocks extended their climb, putting the Topix on track for its longest winning streak in 16 years, after the US and China agreed to de-escalate tariffs, boosting risk-on sentiment and sending the yen lower.
item.dc:creator: Alice French, Aya Wagatsuma

media:content.media:description: The Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE), operated by Japan Exchange Group Inc. (JPX), in Tokyo, Japan, on Friday, Feb. 16, 2024. Japanese stock prices are within sight of a historic peak reached during the nation’s economic heyday in 1989 as global investors return in droves.

item.title: Phillips 66 Holders Should Vote for Four Elliott Nominees, ISS Says
item.description: Shareholders of Phillips 66 should vote for all four board candidates nominated by activist investor Elliott Investment Management in its upcoming annual meeting, said proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services Inc.
item.dc:creator: Crystal Tse

media:content.media:description: The Phillips 66 Los Angeles refinery in Wilmington, California, US, on Thursday, March 21, 2024. Phillips 66 is scheduled to release earnings figures on April 26.

item.title: Australia’s Business Conditions Ease, Boosting Case for RBA Cuts
item.description: Australian business conditions eased in April as profitability weakened, forward orders slipped and firms’ spending plans took a hit, boosting the case for the Reserve Bank to cut interest rates to support the economy.
item.dc:creator: Swati Pandey

item.title: Morgan Stanley Is Leading IPO for Software Maker Figma
item.description: Design software business Figma Inc. hired Morgan Stanley to lead what could be one of the year’s biggest initial public offerings, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Katie Roof

media:content.media:description: The Figma logo on a smartphone and the Adobe logo on a laptop arranged in the Brooklyn borough of New York, US, on Friday, July 28, 2023. Adobe Inc.s $20 billion takeover of design startup Figma Inc. is on course for an in-depth investigation from European Union merger regulators, adding to growing global scrutiny of the deal dubbed by Adobes boss as transformational.

item.title: Oil Steadies After Trade-Deal Gain as Focus Turns to Middle East
item.description: Oil steadied after three days of advances, as attention moved away from the deescalation of the US-China trade war and to the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen

item.title: Marubeni CEO Is Aligned With Buffett on Long-Term Partnership
item.description: The top executive at Marubeni Corp. affirmed the Japanese trading house’s commitment to a long-term partnership with Berkshire Hathaway Inc., echoing sentiments recently expressed by the US investment firm.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Stapczynski

item.title: Bond Traders Eye Inflation for Rate Clues as Recession Odds Fade
item.description: The temporary US-China trade truce dimmed the odds of a recession and sparked a selloff in Treasuries, raising the stakes for investors ahead of the release of inflation figures for the world’s biggest economy.
item.dc:creator: Liz Capo McCormick

item.title: Korean Insurer Halts Bond Call Plan After Regulator’s Opposition
item.description: The South Korean general insurer that rattled investors with its early bond redemption plan last week abruptly halted it after the move drew a quick rebuke from the financial regulator.
item.dc:creator: Haram Lim

media:content.media:description: Illuminated buildings at the Yeouido financial district at dusk in Seoul. Bloomberg

item.title: JD.com’s Low Profitability in Focus as Traders Brace for Results
item.description: Investors are prepared for a big jolt in battered shares of JD.com Inc. following an earnings report from the Chinese e-commerce company, which is mounting a costly foray into food delivery.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

media:content.media:description: Food delivery riders of JD Takeaway, left, and Meituan in Shenyang, China, in April 2025. Source: Visual China Group/Getty Images

item.title: Gold Holds Heavy Loss as Markets Latch Onto US-China Optimism
item.description: Gold steadied after a sharp selloff as a major de-escalation in US-China trade tensions hurt demand for havens.
item.dc:creator: Sybilla Gross

media:content.media:description: Gold bars, part of the Czech National Bank's reserves arranged in Prague, Czech Republic, on Tuesday, Feb. 25, 2025. Gold’s recent record-breaking run has been broadly supported by haven demand, amid concern and increasing confusion over US President Donald Trump’s plan to enact sweeping tariffs. Photographer: Milan Jaros/Bloomberg
